snippet: Law enforcement officials say a building in Chinatown harbored a huge illegal betting operation, but the charges suggest and people from the building say that at most, there were friendly, low-stakes games being played there.
abstract: Charges against and interviews with people in a Chinatown building where a raid resulted in arrests over gambling activity suggest that at most, friendly, low-stakes games were being played, but that it was not the vast criminal enterprise alleged by federal and local law enforcement officials; conflicting portrayals of the building's activities suggest how the norms of immigrant life can sometimes clash with those of broader New York City.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and JEFFREY E. SINGER

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials say a building in Chinatown harbored a huge illegal betting operation, but the charges suggest and people from the building say that at most, there were friendly, low-stakes games being played there.

headline.seo: Gambling Raid in Chinatown Reveals a Difference in Cultures
headline.main: Chinatown Gambling Raid May Reveal Cultural Divide
headline.print_headline: Chinatown Gambling Raid May Reveal Cultural Divide
